meanings.definition: A round, hollow bread that can be filled with various ingredients.
meanings.sent1: I love to fill my pitas with fresh vegetables and hummus.
meanings.sent2: At the party, everyone enjoyed the delicious pitas filled with chicken and tzatziki sauce.
meanings.sent3: Why did the sandwich go to the bakery? To become a pita!
meanings.sent4: The pitas on the table looked like little edible bowls waiting to be devoured.
meanings.sent5: The warm aroma of baking pitas filled the kitchen, making everyone hungry.

meanings.definition: The act of throwing or tossing something.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the players showed off their skills in pitas.
meanings.sent2: He demonstrated his pitas by tossing the ball high into the air.
meanings.sent3: The clown's pitas with juggling balls made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her pitas of throwing cards accurately at the target amazed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The pitas of the baseball pitcher were so precise, he never missed his target.
